description: Mobile techniques used by Encrypt Network Traffic, ATT&CK mitigation M1009 v1.0
name: Encrypt Network Traffic (M1009)

techniques.comment: Application-layer encryption (e.g. use of the Transport Layer Security protocol) or a Virtual Private Network (VPN) tunnel (e.g. using the IPsec protocol) may help mitigate weaknesses in the cellular network encryption.

Use of end-to-end encryption of voice calls and text messages "provides another layer in the defense against potential information compromise by SS7 enabled eavesdropping."(Citation: CSRIC5-WG10-FinalReport)

App developers should be advised to use the Android Network Security Configuration feature and the iOS App Transport Security feature to gain some level of assurance that app network traffic is protected.(Citation: Google-TrustManager)
This mitigation may not always be effective depending on the method used to encrypt network traffic. In some cases, an adversary may be able to capture traffic before it is encrypted.

Application-layer encryption (e.g. use of the Transport Layer Security protocol) or a Virtual Private Network (VPN) tunnel (e.g. using the IPsec protocol) may help mitigate use of untrusted Wi-Fi networks.
